snippet.title: How to Learn a Cheerleading Dance | Cheerleading
snippet.description:
Full Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL739AEE86D4A395F4
-
-
Like these Cheerleader Lessons !!! Check out the official app http://apple.co/1OT7Bfv

Get your Routine together with these Cheerleading Products!
Classic Cheerleading Megaphones: http://amzn.to/1W0J34F
Gold Plastic Cheerleading Megaphones Charms: http://amzn.to/1KolI90
Chassé Girls' Cheer Weekender Backpack: http://amzn.to/1QfL9cY
Alleson Cheerleading Rain Jacket: http://amzn.to/1OcWnkT
Pom-Pom Assortment: http://amzn.to/1Y9wOES
Cheer Flexibility & Fitness Training Combo (Kinetic Bands & Stunt Strap): http://amzn.to/1Ke9kHq

Watch more How to Be a Cheerleader videos: http://www.howcast.com/videos/500333-How-to-Learn-a-Cheerleading-Dance-Cheerleading



Dances in cheerleading are always to eight counts. And no matter where you're learning a dance for cheerleading, knowing how to learn a dance is very important. Step one. Start off by learning the first four counts of the dance. And once you have those, you can move on and learn the next four. Remember to count out loud.

Alright. So we're going to start this one off to the side and we're going to hold. Five. Six. Seven. Eight. We're going to hit a high beat on one. We're going to swing it around on two. Punch it three. We're going to clean to the side on four. Do you have that much? Okay. From here, we're just going to hit five. Bring it down to our knee on six. Pull it back up on seven. And then back down on eight.

Step two. Now that you know the first eight count of the dance, start from the beginning, go through the entire first eight count, and then add on four more counts. So moving on from here we're going to clean on one. We're going to punch it up on two. We're going to punch it across on three. And then we're going to bring it up on four. Continue doing this pattern of starting from the beginning, adding on four more counts, until you get to the very end.

Step three is to do the dance full out to counts. Now that you know all of the moves for all of the counts, you can start from the beginning, and count out loud, until you make it from the beginning to the end, several times. Alright. Let's do this one all the way through. Five. Six. Seven. Eight. One. Two. Three. Four. Five. Six. Seven. Eight. One. Two. Three. Four. Five. Six. Seven. Eight. One. Two. Three. Four. Five. Six. Seven. Eight. One. Two. Three. Four. Five. Six. Seven. Eight.

Step four is dance to the music. Listen to the track a couple of times, and know exactly when the first count of the dance starts. And this how you learn a cheer dance.

snippet.title: Watch Me Dance | Dance and Freeze | Brain Break | Jack Hartmann Freeze Dance
snippet.description:
Watch Me Dance is another Jack Hartmann classic freeze dance song.  Take a brain break and shake. Listen carefully for when Jack Hartmann tells you to freeze. Listen, freeze and dance along with Jack.

Lyrics
I can do the disco, yes I can
Watch me, watch me, watch me dance
Do the Disco with me
Do the Disco and freeze
I can do the Cha-Cha, yes I can
Watch me, watch me, watch me dance
I can do the Twist, yes I can
Watch me, watch me, watch me dance
Do the Twist with me
Do the Twist and freeze
Now clap your hands and stomp your feet
Turn around, have fun with me
I can do the Cowboy, yes I can
Watch me, watch me, watch me dance
Do the Cowboy with me
Do the Cowboy and freeze
I can do the Cabbage Patch, yes I can
Watch me, watch me, watch me dance
Do the Cabbage Dance with me
Do the Cabbage Dance and freeze
I can do the Chicken, yes I can
Watch me, watch me, watch me dance
Do the Chicken with me
Do the Chicken and freeze
Now clap your hands and stomp your feet
Turn around, have fun with me
I can do the Roly Poly, yes I can
Watch me, watch me, watch me dance
Do the Roly Poly with me
Do the Roly Poly and freeze

snippet.title: How to Dance to Hip-Hop Music | Beginner Dancing
snippet.description:
Full Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLALQuK1NDrhxI-A93uUIOuv57jJ8fCm6
-
-
Learning to Dance? Here’s some resources to help you on the Dancefloor
Sansha Hi-Step Dance Sneaker: http://amzn.to/1WNCFhl
DANCESOCKS - Sneaker Socks for Dancing on Carpet: http://amzn.to/1WNCBOI
Dancing: The Pleasure, Power, and Art of Movement: http://amzn.to/1hrbDMY
Dance Anatomy: http://amzn.to/1MeNK3D
The Dance Bible: The Complete Resource for Aspiring Dancers: http://amzn.to/1LiAq1U

Watch more Dancing for Beginners videos: http://www.howcast.com/videos/511091-How-to-Dance-to-HipHop-Music-Beginner-Dancing




Ava:  Hi everybody. I'm Ava. This is my sister Loretta and this is Anthony. Right now we're going to show you some three basic moves on how to dance to hip-hop music. The main thing with hip-hop I guess is just be, like, relaxed and, like, have fun. Not too serious. Like you don't want to stand up too straight because you'll be, like, stiff, you know. You're going to stand basically, like, shoulder width apart with your feet and your knees are going to bent a little bit. This is pretty much where you live and where you start with all of your hip-hop grooves. 

The first hip-hop groove Loretta is going to take us through.

Loretta:  We can do just a basic kick-ball-change. You're going to take one foot, you're just going kick in front. Then you're going to cross it over. Then the back foot is going to step back. Then you're going to do the same thing. Kick, step, back. Kick, step, back. Kick, step, back. When you double time it, here we go. One-and-two, three-and-four, five-and-six, seven-and-eight. 

You could also add a little bounce to it, to the beat. That's the relaxed, chill mood of hip-hop. Let's do it again. Five, six, seven, eight. One-and-two, three-and-four, five-and-six, seven-and-eight. Awesome. Next move.

Anthony:  Sweet. Now we're going to break into the slide and step. We're going to slide and hit, slide and hit. And hit. Now if you want to get some more energy it's going to be a hop, and hop, and hop, and hop. Now let's put that together. To the right. Five, six, seven, eight. Slide and hop, and hop, and hop. Awesome

Ava:  I'm feeling hip-hoppy already. OK, so one more move we're going to show you is just basically you're going to stand shoulder width apart and your hands are going to come out and then come in and then come out and then come in. While you do that your hips are going to move with it. They're going to go out, in, out, in, out, in, out, in. Right? We're going to start together and then we're going to jump out as we do this and add a little bit of bounce to it. Five, six, seven, eight. Out, in, out, in, out, in, out, in. Awesome.

Loretta:  Those are three basic steps that you can do to dance to hip-hop music. Go through them one more time. First one, kick-ball-change. Five, six, seven, eight. Kick-ball-change, kick-ball-change, kick-ball-change, kick-ball-change. 

Anthony:  Now we have the slide hop. Five, six, seven, eight. Slide, slide, slide, slide.

Ava:  Awesome. And the last one. Your arms go out and in with the hips. Five, six, seven, eight. One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight.

That's how you dance to hip-hop music.

snippet.title: The Weather Song | Song for children & kids with dance actions | English Through Music
snippet.description:
LYRICS:
What’s the weather like today?
What’s the weather like today?
It’s rainy, It’s rainy

What’s the weather like today?
What’s the weather like today?
It’s sunny (hurray), It’s sunny (hurray)

What’s the weather like today?
What’s the weather like today?
It’s windy, It’s windy

What’s the weather like today?
What’s the weather like today?
It’s cloudy (sigh), It’s cloudy (sigh)

What’s the weather like today?
What’s the weather like today?
It’s snowy (brrrr), It’s snowy (brrrr)


Watch the 'Hello Goodbye Song': http://youtu.be/lzZQDdGHF4s
English Through Music http://www.englishthroughmusic.es
Song for children about the weather, and for teaching how to ask questions and use the Present Simple 
For LYRICS on screen: Click the small box with 2 lines in it (bottom of video), when the video is playing.
VOCABULARY: Weather, It's Rainy, Sunny, Windy, Cloudy, Snowy.
GRAMMAR: Asking questions, Contractions.

Find out more at http://www.englishthroughmusic.es
SUBCRIBE to http://www.youtube.com/englishthroughmusic
SHARE this video with your friends and other teachers!
LIKE the facebook page http://www.facebook.com/etmmadrid

This is a fun song for kids to learn about the weather, which can be used every day in class or at home, it includes key vocabulary, sunny, windy, snowy etc... which is easy to remember, as well as some sound effects which your kids can make themselves which accompany basic actions.

snippet.title: Bhangra & Ballet | Dance Video | Indian Folk Dance | Indian Culture | Jalebi Street
snippet.description:
Hey kids! This time the kids are spinning to the instructions of their new dance coach, for their annual day performance. He will make the kids dance to styles such as ballet, Garba, Bharatnatyam and Bhangra. Bubble performs her ‘Bubble Dance’ and Div shows off the ballet, which Bunny tries to copy amidst much laughter. Join the fun as the coach demonstrates several Indian dance forms and the kids try to learn the dandiya and bhangra.
Learn the fun dance steps along with the kids only on Jalebi Street.

Come find us on Facebook, https://www.facebook.com/JalebiStreet/

snippet.title: How to Dance on Beat | Beginner Dancing
snippet.description:
Full Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLALQuK1NDrhxI-A93uUIOuv57jJ8fCm6
-
-
Learning to Dance? Here’s some resources to help you on the Dancefloor
Sansha Hi-Step Dance Sneaker: http://amzn.to/1WNCFhl
DANCESOCKS - Sneaker Socks for Dancing on Carpet: http://amzn.to/1WNCBOI
Dancing: The Pleasure, Power, and Art of Movement: http://amzn.to/1hrbDMY
Dance Anatomy: http://amzn.to/1MeNK3D
The Dance Bible: The Complete Resource for Aspiring Dancers: http://amzn.to/1LiAq1U

Watch more Dancing for Beginners videos: http://www.howcast.com/videos/511070-How-to-Dance-on-Beat-Beginner-Dancing

Learn how to dance on beat with this dance video from Howcast.

Loretta: Hi, everybody. My name is Loretta and this is my sister, Ava. We're the Double-Time Twins, and today we're going to teach you how to dance on beat. So the first thing you should remember when you do this is basically just listen to the music and get into the groove of the music. The easiest thing you could do is clap. So when you hear your instructor or someone talk . . .

Ava: Wait. When you hear your instructor, or if you're ever taking class and they count to eight, that's what they're counting. They're counting the beat. So they go, "One, two, three, four . . ."

Both:  ". . . Five, six, seven, eight". 

Loretta:  They're doing that to help you so you can dance on beat. 

Ava: On beat. 

Loretta: So I can do that, and Ava, you could do a dance move so they could see what it's like to dance on beat. 

Ava: Okay. 

Loretta: So we got five, six, seven, eight. One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight. Awesome. That is how you dance on beat.

So the first thing you should remember when you do this is basically just listen to the music and get into the groove of the music. The easiest thing you could do is clap. So when you hear your instructor or someone talk . . .

Ava: Wait. When you hear your instructor, or if you're ever taking class and they count to eight, that's what they're counting. They're counting the beat. So they go, "One, two, three, four . . ."

Both:  ". . . Five, six, seven, eight". 

Loretta:  They're doing that to help you so you can dance on beat. 

Ava: On beat. 

Loretta: So I can do that, and Ava, you could do a dance move so they could see what it's like to dance on beat. 

Ava: Okay. 

Loretta: So we got five, six, seven, eight. One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight. Awesome. That is how you dance on beat.

snippet.title: Kids Dance Challenge 2020
snippet.description:
This June, we are launching our brand-new DANCE CHALLENGE and we would LOVE for you and your school to get involved!

We know things have been tough recently, so our aim throughout this challenge is to bring families together, create happy memories and have plenty of fun along the way. 

Children big and small are invited to take part and create their very own dance video where anything goes! 🤪

The only rule is to have LOTS OF FUN!

HERE'S HOW IT WORKS:

- Each week children are given a theme
- Using that theme, they create their own dance routine - use our videos for inspiration, create something totally wacky and unique, or just dance along with us!
- Create a video of the performance (no fancy camera’s needed – a phone is fine!)
- Ask parents to post the video onto social media using our hashtags.
- Get sharing and liking: the video with the most likes each week WINS!

SO, WHAT DO YOU WIN?

The purpose of this challenge is to have LOADS OF FUN… but we want to dish out some prizes too!

✅ A challenge is not a challenge without a certificate – so EVERY CHILD who submits a video will get a downloadable certificate to put on their bedroom wall!

✅ Instant stardom - videos will be seen by thousands every day on our social media channels and there's the possibility of earning a fortune as the next internet sensation! 😉

✅ And because every child LOVES a trophy, the “Dance Superstar” who gets the most likes will receive a SHINY TROPHY to keep forever! Plus a FREE DANCE SUBSCRIPTION for their school (worth £495)

READY TO FIND THE NEXT DANCE SUPERSTAR?

Below are the weekly themes - the links can be shared with your children and include more detail about each challenge, an imoves video for inspiration and a music file!

- Samba (starts 8 June): https://imoves.com/home-learning/1545
- Hip Hop (starts 15 June): https://imoves.com/home-learning/1546
- Disco (starts 22 June): https://imoves.com/home-learning/1544
- Bollywood (starts 29 June): https://imoves.com/home-learning/1547

Join us in this challenge and let's bring families together, have lots of fun getting active, and create happy memories that will last a lifetime. 

I really hope this provides some much needed focus and entertainment for your children.  

Happy dancing,

Imogen

P.S. This challenge is not just for kids! Why not get all your teachers and parents involved too? You could even have a dance off to see who gets the most likes :-)

P.P.S. First up is our Samba Challenge which starts on 8th June but kids can get started NOW - share this link (https://imoves.com/home-learning/1545) with children and their parents and let’s get EVERYONE involved. Have fun!

snippet.title: HOW TO DANCE FOR BEGINNERS! 🎉🙂 Easy tutorial for club, party, disco, rave, street
snippet.description:
Easy dance moves for beginners. Simple tutorial on how to dance.
Please LIKE and SHARE.
Music and shirts: http://DANCEWITHLEROY.com

Hi and welcome to today's dance class
with moi Leroy und Joachim the disciple

Today we are going through moves such as
Bicycle Pump und Put in Bag

But we start with just legs
Simple stomping
stomp, stomp, stomp, stomp
stomping, stomping, stomping, stomping
stomping
As I said - Just Legs

Und then we have the Small Ball
like this - small ball, small ball
Remember to keep your knees bouncing
right, left, right, left, right, left
Big Ball!
Big ball, both balls - this is Both Balls
works very well with the mafia, ja

Und then we Pick the Apples in this fashion
The shrooms they are a-coming!
pick the apples, pick the shrooms
this is the transition
pick the apples, pick the shrooms
easily done

Und then we have the Bicycle Pump
makes a good impression from the side
Intense!
And pump

We are starting to get it!

Wash the Laundry
wash the laundry
wash the laundry

and stomp

Welcome to the second part - the hard part
where we go loose proper psychedelic

We start with The-Hard-Ping-Pong-Move
the-to-be-continued-thing, OK?
Here it is - as follows
we Serve - The Psychedelic Eyes
and start to Go Loose - go loose!
And Play the Ping-Pong - serve!
There it is! Serve the Ping-Pong

When you know all those easy things
it is time to Walk the Dog, right?
Like this - not hard at all, is it?
But!
Like a real psychonaut in a psychedelic spirit
you will first have to Pet the Dog
pet the dog, pet the dog
Almost like Ping-Pong but remember to
Pet the Dog when you Walk the Dog
Pet and walk the dog!
Easily done - pet and walk the dog
The hand behind your back!
pet the dog and walk the dog

After the dog we have the cow and the bull
very hard moves
Keep your knees bouncing - to the sides
relax your shoulders!
Milk the Cow
There it is - you can handle it!
Milk the cow
That was Milk the Cow
since it is called the Cow and the Bull
there must be a bull aswell, right?
A little bit like this
remember the eyebrows and the knees
The eyebrows!
A fixed firm gaze towards your partner
milk it, milk it, milk it
like that
Milk the Cow and Milk the Bull

Our last move is the Chernobyl Child
with the hand in its neck!

Thanks

------------

And that's how you dance at a party :)

http://facebook.com/dancewithleroy

A.k.a. HOW TO DANCE AT A RAVE

snippet.title: 3 Easy Dance Moves | Full-Time Kid | PBS Parents
snippet.description:
You can dance if you want to, you can leave your shoes behind! You don't need a rocket, track, or garden to do the Moonwalk, Running Man and Cabbage Patch dance moves. You just need socks, energy and a little guidance from Mya, the Full-Time Kid! 

Meet Mya! She's a full-time kid and proud of it. Her job is sharing fun educational tricks, cute crafts, songs and surprises that kids and parents will enjoy.

Producers: Danielle Steinberg, Mary Hope Garcia, Tracey Wynne

Season 2 in collaboration with Fox Frame Productions:
http://www.foxframeproductions.com/
https://vimeo.com/foxframe

snippet.title: 5-a-day Fitness: Big Jubilee Dance
snippet.description:
The Big Jubilee Dance is exclusively produced by www.5-a-day.tv for Big Dance. It will take you and friends on a journey of music and dance through the six decades of the Queen's reign.

The Big Jubilee Dance is a fun, simple dance routine for all ages to perform in celebration of the Queen's Diamond Jubilee weekend 2-5 June and ideal to do as part of your celebrations at The Big Jubilee Lunch on 3 June.

The Big Jubilee Lunch is part of the annual lottery funded initiative from the Eden Project.  The Big Lunch encourages people to come together for lunch in their communities once a year.  More information can be found here: www.thebiglunch.com

An audio version is available with a voice over of instructions to follow if no screen is available at your picnic is available to download now at www.bigdance2012.com

snippet.title: Beat of the Body Dance Party | LEVEL 1: Learn it! | DANCE VIDEOS FOR KIDS
snippet.description:
The Jump with Jill Danceable Music Video Series helps you incorporate movement breaks between coursework, offer an alternative physical education class, or create a performance event for your entire school. 

In this video, the hit song from the Jump with Jill show about exercise, "The Beat of the Body," features the transformative power of physical activity by flipping a typical 5th grade classroom into a dance party. 

Make your way through all three levels until you master the moves. Then use the audio track to make videos of your own!

In this video, you'll learn:

How to raise the roof
How to do the robot
How to dance like Lady Gaga

Get the Music: http://www.jumpwithjill.com/product-category/cd/
Website: http://www.jumpwithjill.com/danceparty/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/JumpWithJill

Nursery rhymes / baby songs / kids songs accelerate phonemic awareness improving children's word comprehension, reading and writing skills. Rhymes for children with actions teach children basic skills; boosts memory, listening skills and ability to follow directions. 5. Letters

7. Lullabies

snippet.title: How to Dance Alone | Beginner Dancing
snippet.description:
Full Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLALQuK1NDrhxI-A93uUIOuv57jJ8fCm6
-
-
Learning to Dance? Here’s some resources to help you on the Dancefloor
Sansha Hi-Step Dance Sneaker: http://amzn.to/1WNCFhl
DANCESOCKS - Sneaker Socks for Dancing on Carpet: http://amzn.to/1WNCBOI
Dancing: The Pleasure, Power, and Art of Movement: http://amzn.to/1hrbDMY
Dance Anatomy: http://amzn.to/1MeNK3D
The Dance Bible: The Complete Resource for Aspiring Dancers: http://amzn.to/1LiAq1U

Watch more Dancing for Beginners videos: http://www.howcast.com/videos/511072-How-to-Dance-Alone-Beginner-Dancing



Loretta:  Hey, everyone, what's up?  My name is Loretta. This is my sister, Ava. We're the Double Time Twins.  And today we're going to teach you to dance by yourself. So the two main things to remember when you're dancing by yourself is to just have confidence and have fun doing  whatever it is you're doing.  The cool thing about dancing by yourself is that you don't have to do somebody else's rhythm. You don't have to work.

Ava:  So if Loretta's in a slow kind of groove, but you don't feel like doing that groove, that's totally fine because you're dancing by yourself.  So whatever groove you want to do, you can do. Okay, so Loretta's going to demonstrate how you can dance by yourself on the dance floor. So, since you have the entire dance floor by yourself, you're not going to stay in one box, right?  

Loretta:  Right.

Ava:  So, Loretta's going to show you how to dance in a box. No, a little box. Like if you didn't have the whole dance floor, you would just stand in a box like this, because there's other people around you, right? But you have the whole dance floor to yourself because you're dancing by yourself. So, you're going to use it.  So, dance in a big box, like you have the whole dance floor, right?

Loretta:  Alright.

Ava:  Okay, so we go, step, together, step, together, step, together, step, together.  So, we can go to the side first.  Side, together. Then you can take it back. Back, together. Take it to the other side. Side, together. Then take it back up front. Stop, Front, together. Awesome, let's do that again. Five, six, seven, eight.  Step, together, take it back. Take it side. Take it front. Awesome. Alright, so, let's do that faster as if we have the whole dance floor together.

Loretta:  Well, you want to do that because I'm dancing by myself?

Ava:  Right, Loretta can do it because she's dancing by herself. Five, six, seven, eight.  One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight.  One, two, three, you can turn while you're doing it, too. Awesome, six, seven, eight. Remember, just have fun, own it, love it. You're dancing by yourself, it's your own groove.

snippet.title: How to Do Old School Jazz Funk Moves | Jazz Dance
snippet.description:
Full Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF6166F725D8AA1DE
-
-
Watch more Jazz Dance Moves for Beginners videos: http://www.howcast.com/videos/501776-How-to-Do-Old-School-Jazz-Funk-Moves-Jazz-Dance



Alright, here are a couple of my favorite old school jazz funk moves. The first one is a little rock step. Let's do the lower body first. Up, up, down, down, up, up, down, down, up, up, down, down. The upper body rocks it out with the shoulders. Let's put it together. And we're going. Up, up, down, down, up, up, down, down, up, up, down, down. 

You can just rock that and have a really good time with it. Next old school jazz move is, I call it the king of VOP step because Frank Hatchett originally did it. And feet go in, one heel, the toe comes up, and then the inside toe goes up on rowan. Then you reverse it. Toes in, one toe up, then the heel on the other leg. Then you keep going. Up, down, and up. It's a little bit trickier than it looks, but it's a lot of fun to do once you get going and then you work it out a little bit faster. Good. So breaking that down again, feet go in, toe heel, feet go in, toe heel.

Alright, that's king of VOP step. Next one is like a jump, jump rock. So, we're going to go jump, jump, jump and rock, jump, jump, jump and rock. A little bit slower. You're just pushing your hands up, really fun party, go jump, jump, keep your knees nice and soft and pick up your foot, pop your shoulders and step it out. One more time to the left. Jump, jump, jump and rock. And five, six, seven eight. Up, up, down... move it back, king of VOP, in and rock it out. Move it back. Good. Jump it out. Ready and. And those are just a couple old school funk jazz moves for you

snippet.title: Armin van Buuren Teaches Dance Music | Official Trailer
snippet.description:
In his MasterClass, Armin van Buuren breaks down his process for creating hit tracks and epic DJ sets. You’ll learn his personal approach to building massive drops, recording vocalists, reading crowds, and engaging with fans.

Learn more about Armin van Buuren’s MasterClass on Dance Music: https://mstr.cl/34gNbIT

One of dance music’s all-time legends, Armin Van Buuren has been creating epic DJ sets since the late ’90s. Here, he’ll share his advice on the gear you need to succeed as a DJ as he provides insight into his audio projects.

Armin Van Buuren Teaches Dance Music will help you learn how to share your music with the world, whether mixing beats at home or performing for crowds. Gain access to video lessons and a customized workbook tailored to each chapter to unlock your creative potential.

In his online class, Armin teaches you how to:
•  Record in Logic Pro and Ableton
•  Turn musical ideas into compositions
•  Work with vocalists
•  Build a massive drop
•  Prepare music for a DJ set
•  Make track edits and mashups
•  Read a crowd
•  Connect with fans on social media

About MasterClass:
MasterClass is the streaming platform where anyone can learn from the world's best. With an annual membership, subscribers get unlimited access to instructors and classes across a wide range of subjects. Each class features about 20 video lessons, at an average of 10 minutes per lesson. You can learn on your own terms — in bite-sized pieces or binge it all at once. Cinematic visuals and close-up, hands-on demonstrations make you feel one-on-one with the instructors, while the downloadable workbooks help reinforce your learning. With MasterClass, you can stream thousands of lessons anywhere, anytime, on mobile, desktop and TV.

• Subscribe: https://mstr.cl/30SH1wj
• Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/masterclassofficial
• Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/masterclass
• Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/masterclass

#MasterClass #ArminvanBuuren #dancemusic

snippet.title: Barso Re (Guru) || How to Bollywood Dance-Tutorial || Francesca McMillan
snippet.description:
Learn dance steps to the Bollywood Classic 'Barso Re' from the movie Guru. The music of this film is directed by A.R. Rahman with lyrics by Gulzar. 'Barso Re' is sung by Shreya Ghoshal and features the always stunning Aishwarya Rai Bachchan joyously dancing in the rain! The soundtrack of 'Guru' won numerous accolades including the Filmfare, IIFA, Zee cine and Starscreen awards for Best Music Direction for A.R. Rahman. Shreya Ghoshal won the same 4 awards for Best Playback singer Female for this song.

Performance Link: https://youtu.be/8c2oU102EH4
Song Link: http://apple.co/2qNGYlS

snippet.title: Snow Man Freeze Song ⛄️ Freeze Dance ⛄️ Winter Song for Kids ⛄️ Brain Breaks by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Snow Man Freeze Song is a popular winter song for children. It is by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station) and sung by Don Monopoli. Snow Man Freeze is a FUN freeze dance and brain break that kids LOVE! Download “Snow Man Freeze”: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/product/snowman-freeze/

Snowman Freeze
 by The Learning Station® and sung by Don Monopoli (Also, known as Learning Station)
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station  
Lyrics: 
We’ll roll the snow
Into a big ball
To make the bottom of a snowman - Freeze!

We’ll pat the snow
Around that big ball
We’ve got the bottom of a snowman - Freeze!
We’ll make a snowman. We’ll make a snowman.
We’ll make a snowman. Freeze! 
We’ll make a snowman. We’ll make a snowman.
We’ll make a snowman. Freeze! 
  
We’ll roll the snow
Into a medium ball
To make the middle of the snowman-Freeze!

We’ll pat the snow
Around that medium ball
We’ve got the middle of the snowman - Freeze!    
We’ll make a snowman. We’ll make a snowman.
We’ll make a snowman. Freeze! 
We’ll make a snowman. We’ll make a snowman.
We’ll make a snowman. Freeze!

snippet.title: Twinkle Twinkle Little Star | Learn to Dance
snippet.description:
Watch Our Most Popular Videos Here: https://goo.gl/muybNU
SUBSCRIBE HERE:  http://bit.ly/subscribe2BabyJoyJoy
Twinkle Twinkle Little Star | Learn to Dance

Everyone's a dance star in Baby Joy Joy's world!  What special moves will she teach her friends?  Come along with Baby Joy Joy and find out!  What is your favorite song to dance to?

Watch Baby Joy Joy's Newest Videos Here:  https://goo.gl/dTjMDw
Watch Things I Learned Today Here:  https://goo.gl/wU19BQ
Watch Baby Joy Joy Nursery Rhymes Here:  https://goo.gl/7ByA1q
Watch Baby Joy Joy Baby Songs Here:  https://goo.gl/95zdKH

*Lyrics*
---------------------------------------------
Twinkle Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are
Up above the world so high
Like a diamond in the sky
Twinkle Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are

Shine Shine, Little Sun
You shine when the night is done
Make the heavens fill with light
Chase away the lonely night
Shine Shine, Little Sun
Now you're out, let's have some fun

Jump Jump, Jump so high
See if you can touch the sky
Jump to the left, jump to the right
Push your feet with all your might
Jump Jump, Jump so high
Jump so high you touch the sky

Twinkle Twinkle, Little Star
I'm a star like you
I can move and I can groove
I can twinkle, too!

Spin Spin, Spin around
Wobble Wobble, don't fall down
When you spin you might get dizzy
Spinning keeps your feet so busy
Spin Spin, Spin around
Wobble Wobble, Whoops! Fell down.

Clap Clap, Clap your hands
Clapping loudly is so grand
Clap up high, clap down low
Clap so fast and then clap slow
Clap Clap, Clap your hands
Lots of clapping's what we planned

Twinkle Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are
Up above the world so high
Like a diamond in the sky
Twinkle Twinkle, Little Star
How I wonder what you are

What are you?
Well, you're sure cute

snippet.title: How to Dance to Rock Music | Beginner Dancing
snippet.description:
Full Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLLALQuK1NDrhxI-A93uUIOuv57jJ8fCm6
-
-
Learning to Dance? Here’s some resources to help you on the Dancefloor
Sansha Hi-Step Dance Sneaker: http://amzn.to/1WNCFhl
DANCESOCKS - Sneaker Socks for Dancing on Carpet: http://amzn.to/1WNCBOI
Dancing: The Pleasure, Power, and Art of Movement: http://amzn.to/1hrbDMY
Dance Anatomy: http://amzn.to/1MeNK3D
The Dance Bible: The Complete Resource for Aspiring Dancers: http://amzn.to/1LiAq1U

Watch more Dancing for Beginners videos: http://www.howcast.com/videos/511092-How-to-Dance-to-Rock-Music-Beginner-Dancing

Learn how to dance to rock music with this dance video from Howcast.

Loretta:  Hey everybody, what's up?  My name's Loretta. This is my twin sister, Ava. This is Anthony. Today, we're going to teach you how to dance to rock music. So the basic thing that you want to do when you're listening to rock, if you're at a concert, if you're at a club or anything, is basically, just to feel the beat in your attitude, right?  So when you're in it, what do we all do when we hear rock music?  

Anthony:  Raise our arms.

Loretta:  Our arm is up and that's what you do. As cliche as it might possibly be, that's what feels good and that's just kind of like how your body goes. So one arm is up and your head goes with it and your arm pulses front; one two, three, four; add a bounce; five, six, seven, eight.

Anthony:  And another thing you guys want to keep in mind, is that you don't want to just wave your arms around like you don't care. But if you stay on beat and really feel the pulse, people around you are going to pick up on that, and you're going to look like a cool guy or girl.

Loretta:  And you're going to be rocking out. It's going to be awesome. Another move that we could do is the air guitar.

Ava:  The air guitar.

Anthony:  The air guitar, so our air guitar is a simple two-step, which is rock and hit, rock and hit, rock and hit, rock and hit.  Now you can bring it low, if you want. We can rock and hit low, rock and hit low, rock and hit low, rock and hit low. Or you can bring it up and you can slap the face and put it over your head even, and we're rocking it high, rocking it high, rocking it high, rocking it high.

Loretta:  Awesome, so those are two simple dance moves that you can do to rock the music, to rock out with your friends.

snippet.title: Read Aloud Books for Children: Hippo Wants to Dance
snippet.description:
Hippo wants to dance. Won’t anyone dance with her?

Instructions to easily find this video again:
1. Click this ► https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzYgQoR1nCSbrj9l-V7H11Q?sub_confirmation=1
2. Click the red 'Subscribe' button on the page that appears

Find us:
Website ► http://www.onscr.com/
Facebook ► https://www.facebook.com/onscr/
Pinterest ► https://pinterest.com/onscrpin/
Twitter ► https://twitter.com/onscrtweet
Instagram ► https://www.instagram.com/onscrinsta/


This work is a derivative used under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) of:

Hippo Wants to Dance

Available at http://bookdash.org/hippo-wants-dance-megan-andrews-sam-beckbessinger-marisa-steyn/

Illustrated by Megan Andrews
Written by Sam Beckbessinger
Designed by Marisa Steyn
with the help of the Book Dash participants in Cape Town on 5 March 2016.


Transcript:
--------------

Hippo wants to dance.
She jumps up and down on the dusty ground.
THUMP!
THUMP!

“You’re getting dirt on me!”
says Shongololo, sleeping in the sand.
“Go dance somewhere else.”

Hippo wants to dance.
She rolls into the river and splashes her arms and legs.
SPLISH!
SPLASH!

“You’re making me wet!”
says Kingfisher, hunting for her breakfast.
“Go dance somewhere else.”

Hippo wants to dance.
She twirls around and around in a field, kicking her legs up high.
SWOOSH!
SWOOSH!

“Be careful! You nearly kicked me!”
says Meerkat, bathing his babies.
“Go dance somewhere else.”

Hippo wants to dance.
She flops into a puddle of mud and slides around on her nice big belly.
SQUISH!
SQUASH!

“Why don’t you stop dancing?”
asks Donkey, carrying his buckets.
“Why can’t you do something useful instead?”

Hippo is sad.
She is too sad to dance.
She sits on a rock and cries.
The tears roll down her cheeks and fall on the ground.!

PLOP!
PLOP!
Grasshopper hears Hippo’s tears.
He starts dancing around her feet.
HOP!
HOP!

Hippo and Grasshopper start to dance, and the other animals come to look...

HOORAY!

snippet.title: Dance Virtual: The Future of Dance Learning
snippet.description:
http://www.dance-virtual.com/go/the-future-of-dance/

Let Virtual Reality transform your room into a dance studio!

Dancing is fun, but learning to dance is challenging!

Dance moves any time, any speed, from all angles
Try new dance styles without breaking the bank
Avoid the hassle, enjoy the benefits

Enjoy dance lessons at home with Virtual Reality, almost as if you were attending a real dance class. Work on your dance choreography to make your routine really shine. Learn new body movement styles, including health and fitness like yoga and pilates.

For our selection of social partner dances, we have Latin styles like Salsa and Bachata, swing dances like East Coast Swing and West Coast Swing, and Argentine Tango.

Traditional dances include international ballroom (Waltz, Foxtrot, Viennese Waltz, Quickstep, Tango) and international latin (Rumba, Cha-cha, Samba, Jive, Paso doble).

WHY DANCE VIRTUAL?

*Immersive*

Learn dancing by dancing, not watching! Immerse yourself in Virtual Reality to recreate a social event, a group lesson, private lesson teaching, a performance hall, and multiple other locations.

*Convenient*

Avoid traffic, scheduling conflicts, time availability, class costs, and having to put on pants. Learn at your own pace in the comfort of your own home. Review steps on your mobile device.

*Efficient*

Your favorite moves, any time, at any speed, from all angles. Review steps and styling from any angle, practice without a partner, try a new dance style or fast forward to new patterns.


*** Dancing. Virtually. For Real. ***

Our virtual reality (VR) product brings fun back into dancing by eliminating scheduling, getting ready, going through multiple changes of clothes, fighting the weather, finding a sitter for your lovely kids or your furry pets, driving at rush hour, getting stuck in traffic, finding parking, being on time, paying class fees, feeling beginners anxiety, finding practice time, memorization, taking notes and recording video.

Ever hoped that you could rewind your brain to that one class where they taught that one move you really like? Well, now you can! Practice as much as you like and take as long as you want. You won’t be holding the rest of the students back. Or, if you are bored with the current lesson and want to challenge yourself, jump ahead a few lessons.

If you need some reassurance before you step into a real dance floor, we’re here for you. Not everybody is born dancing, some have to learn the hard way. And for the rest of us, Dance-Virtual makes us learn the easy way.

Credits:
MAkehuman community, Google Poly, Deceased Superior Technician
Details: http://dance-virtual.com/about/credits/

snippet.title: How to Do a Pirouette | Ballet Dance
snippet.description:
Watch more Ballet Dancing Lessons videos: http://www.howcast.com/videos/497190-How-to-Do-a-Pirouette-Ballet-Dance



My name is Maegan Woodin, and I'm  a professional dancer, choreographer, teacher and student. I have danced for MTV, Diana Ross, Marc Jacobs and have appeared in many music videos. You can find more information about me and my career, as well as photos and videos, at www.dgtnyc.com. I'm going to be talking to you about ballet. A pirouette in Ballet is a turn that is very commonly found on the basic to intermediate level. The amount of turns depends on the skill of the dancer. So you can start off by just doing a passe in Releve to doing a half turn, to doing a full turn, to doing two, three, four. And for male dancers they can do up to ten pirouettes at a time. So it is important to think about the alignment and the position of your fourth position, which most pirouette's start in. So if you stand in fourth position, again your fourth position shouldn't be too wide, it should be pretty small and your weight should be evenly between both legs. Your arms are going to open up, one arm is to the side one arm is in front. You are going to start in a plie position. When you plie you are going to open up both arms, that is going to be the start of your plie and the start of your pirouette. You are going to open up your arms then bring them together and your foot is going to come passe. So again you are going to plie, open up your arm and everything is going to zip up into passe. And that is the very basic level. And you turn it when you become more advanced. I am now going to demonstrate how to do a pirouette turn, I am going to do a single turn and then I am going to do a double turn.Now I am going to demonstrate a double pirouette.
